intro: Bulbocodium persicum, commonly known as Persian bulbous grass, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Amaryllidaceae and is characterized by its bulbous root system and grass-like foliage. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale blue in color. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in alpine and rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens with suitable growing conditions.
